books.author: Lee Child and Andrew Child
books.contributor: by Lee Child and Andrew Child
books.description: The 28th book in the Jack Reacher series. It’s 1992 and Reacher looks into the cause of a string of mysterious deaths. Read by Scott Brick. 9 hours, 14 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE SECRET

books.author: Abraham Verghese
books.description: Three generations of a family living on South India’s Malabar Coast suffer the loss of a family member by drowning. Read by the author. 31 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE COVENANT OF WATER

books.author: James McBride
books.description: Secrets held by the residents of a dilapidated neighborhood come to life when a skeleton is found at the bottom of a well. Read by Dominic Hoffman. 12 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE HEAVEN & EARTH GROCERY STORE

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: In a sequel to “The Firm,” Mitch McDeere, who is now a partner at the world’s largest law firm, gets caught up in a sinister plot. Read by Edoardo Ballerini. 9 hours, 2 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE EXCHANGE

books.author: Barbara Kingsolver
books.description: Winner of a 2023 Pulitzer Prize for fiction. A reimagining of Charles Dickens’s “David Copperfield” set in the mountains of southern Appalachia. Read by Charlie Thurston. 21 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DEMON COPPERHEAD

books.author: Patrick Rothfuss
books.description: Things go awry when Bast accepts a gift. Read by Nick Podehl and the author. 4 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE NARROW ROAD BETWEEN DESIRES

books.author: Britney Spears
books.description: The Grammy Award-winning pop star details her personal and professional experiences, including the years she spent under a conservatorship overseen by her father. Read by Michelle Williams. 5 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE WOMAN IN ME

books.author: Matthew Perry
books.description: The actor, known for playing Chandler Bing on “Friends,” shares stories from his childhood and his struggles with sobriety. Read by the author. 8 hours, 49 minutes unabridged.
books.title: FRIENDS, LOVERS, AND THE BIG TERRIBLE THING

books.author: Barbra Streisand
books.description: The EGOT winner chronicles her journey in show business and reveals details about some of her personal relationships. Read by the author. 48 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MY NAME IS BARBRA

books.author: David Grann
books.description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively. Read by Will Patton, Ann Marie Lee and Danny Campbell. 9 hours, 45 minutes unabridged.
books.title: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON

books.author: Rachel Maddow
books.description: The MSNBC host and co-author of “Bag Man” details a campaign to overthrow the U.S. government and install authoritarian rule prior to and during our involvement in World War II. Read by the author. 13 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: PREQUEL

books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.description: The author of “The Code Breaker” traces Musk’s life and summarizes his work on electric vehicles, private space exploration and artificial intelligence. Read by Jeremy Bobb. 20 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ELON MUSK

books.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity. Read by Peter Attia. 17 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OUTLIVE

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother. Read by the author. 6 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
books.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: Jada Pinkett Smith
books.description: The actress and talk-show host describes personal and professional difficulties she encountered and her journey to finding self-love. Read by the author. 14 hours, 54 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WORTHY

books.author: Jonathan Karl
books.description: The chief Washington correspondent for ABC News looks at Donald Trump’s impact on the Republican Party. Read by the author. 8 hours, 33 minutes unabridged.
books.title: TIRED OF WINNING

books.author: Henry Winkler with James Kaplan
books.contributor: by Henry Winkler with James Kaplan
books.description: The Emmy Award-winning actor shares how playing roles such as the Fonz and his struggles with dyslexia affected his life. Read by Henry Winkler. 9 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BEING HENRY

books.author: John Stamos with Daphne Young
books.contributor: by John Stamos with Daphne Young
books.description: A memoir by the star of “Full House,” “ER” and “General Hospital.” Read by John Stamos. 8 hours, 44 minutes unabridged.
books.title: IF YOU WOULD HAVE TOLD ME

books.author: Jill Duggar with Derick Dillard and Craig Borlase
books.contributor: by Jill Duggar with Derick Dillard and Craig Borlase
books.description: A behind-the-scenes account of the reality TV series “19 Kids and Counting” and a portrayal of life inside the Duggar family. Read by Jill Duggar. 7 hours, 7 minutes unabridged.
books.title: COUNTING THE COST

books.author: Rick Rubin with Neil Strauss
books.contributor: by Rick Rubin with Neil Strauss
books.title: THE CREATIVE ACT

books.author: Arthur C. Brooks and Oprah Winfrey
books.contributor: by Arthur C. Brooks and Oprah Winfrey
books.title: BUILD THE LIFE YOU WANT

books.author: Ramit Sethi
books.title: I WILL TEACH YOU TO BE RICH, SECOND EDITION

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The fifth book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. As publication seems possible, the baby frogs feel doubt.
books.title: INFLUENCERS

books.author: Aaron Blabey
books.description: The 18th book in the Bad Guys series. New revelations emerge as one character finds her voice.
books.title: THE BAD GUYS IN LOOK WHO'S TALKING

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The 11th book in the Dog Man series. Piggy returns and the Supa Buddies are sabotaged.
books.title: TWENTY THOUSAND FLEAS UNDER THE SEA

books.author: Ann M. Martin.
books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Ellen T. Crenshaw
books.description: The 14th book in the Baby-Sitters Club series. Members of the club have different reactions to visiting New York City.
books.title: STACEY'S MISTAKE

books.author: Gege Akutami
books.description: Hakari and Panda get separated when they search for Kashimo at the Tokyo No. 2 Colony.
books.title: JUJUTSU KAISEN, VOL. 21

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The 10th book in the Dog Man series. Can the power of love overcome the darkness and despair created by new villains?
books.title: MOTHERING HEIGHTS

books.author: Eiichiro Oda
books.description: The battle between Luffy and Kaido approaches an end.
books.title: ONE PIECE, VOL. 104

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The ninth book in the Dog Man series. After turning in his badge, the canine cop is determined not to just roll over.
books.title: GRIME AND PUNISHMENT

books.author: Bill Watterson.
books.contributor: by Bill Watterson. Illustrated by Bill Watterson and John Kascht
books.contributor_note: Illustrated by Bill Watterson and John Kascht
books.description: A battered knight, who was sent on a mission with others by the king to uncover the source of calamities besetting the kingdom, is the only one who returns.
books.title: THE MYSTERIES

books.author: Tatsuki Fujimoto
books.description: A student who is having trouble navigating high school might be brought into contact with Chainsaw Man.
books.title: CHAINSAW MAN, VOL. 12

books.contributor: by Shannon Messenger. Illustrated by Gabriella Chianello
books.description: A 12-year-old who can read minds leaves her family for a new life; adapted into a graphic novel by Celina Frenn.
books.title: KEEPER OF THE LOST CITIES, PART 1

books.author: Scott Cawthon, Kelly Parra and Andrea Waggener.

books.title: FIVE NIGHTS AT FREDDY'S: FAZBEAR FRIGHTS, VOL. 3

books.author: John Patrick Green
books.description: The seventh book in the InvestiGators series. When a delirious cruise captain is found at sea, the search for his ship and its passengers gets underway.
books.title: INVESTIGATORS: ALL TIDE UP

books.author: Tatsuya Endo
books.description: A child who lives a somewhat unremarkable life might face great danger.
books.title: SPY X FAMILY, VOL. 10

books.author: Nathan Hale
books.description: The 12th book in the Hazardous Tales series. An account of how American pilots volunteered to fight for the French military during World War I.
books.title: ABOVE THE TRENCHES

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: Charles Vincent meets someone who ignites his passion and must decide whether to walk away from his perfect-from-the-outside life.
books.title: WITHOUT A TRACE

books.author: Marc Cameron
books.description: The 22nd book in the Jack Ryan series. Ryan goes behind the Berlin Wall in 1985 to investigate an East German defector.
books.title: TOM CLANCY: RED WINTER

books.author: James Patterson and Nancy Allen
books.contributor: by James Patterson and Nancy Allen
books.description: A young lawyer winds up in an Alabama jail that remains mysteriously crowded.
books.title: THE JAILHOUSE LAWYER

books.author: Karin Slaughter
books.description: U.S. Marshal Andrea Oliver goes to Longbill Beach to protect a judge and winds up investigating a cold case from 1982.
books.title: GIRL, FORGOTTEN

books.author: Debbie Macomber
books.description: Two holiday stories: “When Christmas Comes” and “Christmas Letters.”
books.title: FOREVER UNDER THE MISTLETOE

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: Two childhood friends follow in their fathers’ footsteps, which puts them on opposite sides of the law.
books.title: THE BOYS FROM BILOXI

books.author: Ron Carr
books.description: Still trying to get over the college boyfriend who broke her heart, a young woman ends up stranded in his town — and with him.
books.title: BRING ME HOME FOR CHRISTMAS

books.author: Stacy Willingham
books.description: When teenage girls go missing, a psychologist in Baton Rouge grapples with echoes from her past.
books.title: A FLICKER IN THE DARK

books.author: Diana Palmer
books.description: The 12th book in the Wyoming Men series. Erianne Mitchell carries a secret with her to Wyoming. A dashing architect follows her there in hopes of winning back her trust.
books.title: WYOMING PROUD

books.author: Sandra Brown
books.description: A former football star falls for a state prosecutor at the same time he must decide whether to kill his ex-wife, who is on life support, to ensnare her attacker.
books.title: OVERKILL

books.author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.contributor: by William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.description: The second book in the Devil’s Gulch western series. A new sheriff takes on more than 100 men.
books.title: SHOOTING IRON

books.author: Christina Lauren
books.description: Maelyn Jones is stuck in a cycle of calamities as she experiences one holiday over and over again.
books.title: IN A HOLIDAZE

books.author: J.A. Jance
books.description: The 17th book in the Ali Reynolds series. A disgraced former cop on parole seeks revenge.
books.title: COLLATERAL DAMAGE

books.author: Fern Michaels
books.description: An instructor gets asked to train a screen actor to ski one of Colorado’s most treacherous runs.
books.title: FALLING STARS

books.description: Maggie Dawes, a renowned travel photographer, struggles with a medical diagnosis over Christmas.
books.title: THE WISH

books.title: THE  BAD GUYS: A VERY BAD HOLIDAY
